etymology.description: 笨(笨) (bèn, "stupid; clumsy") refers to a lack of dexterity or intelligence. 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") and 腳(脚) (jiǎo, "foot") represent the physical extremities that are associated with actions and movements. The repetition of 笨(笨) (bèn, "stupid; clumsy") with 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") and 腳(脚) (jiǎo, "foot") emphasizes an overall clumsiness or awkwardness in physical movements.
etymology.interpretation: By stating that both the hands and feet are clumsy, 笨手笨腳(笨手笨腳) (bènshǒu bènjiǎo) conveys a strong sense of overall awkwardness in physical coordination.

examples.chinese: 他做事总是笨手笨脚(他做事總是笨手笨腳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuòshì zǒng shì bènshǒu bènjiǎo.
examples.english: He is always clumsy in his work.

examples.chinese: 因为他笨手笨脚(因為他笨手笨腳)，常常打翻杯子(常常打翻杯子)。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi tā bènshǒu bènjiǎo, chángcháng dǎ fān bēizi.
examples.english: Because he is clumsy, he often spills his cup.
